page.title: 06Where people live in Well
page.content: Well is compact village sited around the cross roads.Its boundaries are fixed & only infill building is allowed.There are no estates and only 6 council houses & 4 council bungalows are alike.Many cottages & houses old & new are stone built,others are rendered,some painted and most with pantile rooves.22% are rented houses , few are tied.Apart from the alms houses all have good sized gardens. There are 2 big houses with stables, paddocks and tennis courts,a former rectory,1 public house and several substantial farmhouses.There are two small holiday cottages,1 in good order for sale,the other is delapidated.Most of the older properties have been modernised with central heating and extended.An unusual feature is that there are no street name signs and only the council houses are numbered.
